violations_detected.title: Echo method not used for customer name
violations_detected.evidence: Customer provided name 'Алексей' at 14.940s. Operator responded 'Алексей, из какого города вы звоните?' at 16.200s without echo confirmation. No 'Верно?' or confirmation request made. Customer confirmation not obtained.

violations_detected.title: Echo method not used for customer last name
violations_detected.evidence: Customer provided last name 'Калинин' at 211.638s. Operator repeated 'Калинин' at 212.978s but did not ask for confirmation ('Верно?'). Echo method incomplete - repeat without confirmation.

violations_detected.title: No thank you for waiting after first search
violations_detected.evidence: Operator announced search at 133.483s ('Минуту, пожалуйста') and returned with results at 146.523s. No gratitude expressed for waiting (no 'Спасибо за ожидание' or similar phrase).

violations_detected.title: Long search - FLAG ONLY (40-45s window)
violations_detected.evidence: Search duration 42 seconds (237.178s to 279.376s). Falls in 40-45s flag window. No score reduction applied, but flagged for improvement.

coaching_priorities.recommendation: Must repeat ALL contact data back to customer with explicit confirmation request ('Верно?', 'Правильно?'). Applied correctly for phone (912-778-1421) but missed for name and last name. Ensure EVERY piece of contact information gets: 1) Repeat back, 2) Confirmation question, 3) Customer verbal confirmation.
After EVERY information search, thank the customer for waiting. Use phrases like 'Спасибо за ожидание'. This was done correctly for 2nd and 3rd searches but missed after the first search.
One search took 42 seconds (40-45s flag window). While not a violation, aim to keep all searches under 40 seconds. Consider providing interim updates to customer during longer searches.

7.1.evidence: Proper greeting with company name '74 колеса', operator name 'Ирина', and offer to help. Proper closing with thanks and polite farewell. Customer orientation questions asked twice.

7.2.evidence: Two instances of incomplete echo method: 1) Name 'Алексей' not confirmed with 'Верно?', 2) Last name 'Калинин' repeated but confirmation not requested. Phone number correctly confirmed.
7.2.note: Inconsistent application - correct for phone, incorrect for names

7.3.evidence: Intro at 3.94s (< 5s), disconnect 1.32s after last speech (< 5s)

7.4.evidence: No interruptions detected in conversation flow

6.1.evidence: Call completed normally, no customer hangup

9.1.evidence: Three searches conducted: 13s, 42s, and 24s. The 42s search falls in 40-45s flag window (improvement recommended but no violation).
9.1.note: One search at 42s flagged for improvement

9.3.evidence: First search (13s) completed without thank you. Second and third searches properly acknowledged with 'Спасибо за ожидание'.

3.1.evidence: Customer's issue (website not showing city) resolved by manual order processing with note to specialists

3.6.evidence: Operator searched system before providing product information

5.1.evidence: Order details, delivery info, payment method all provided
5.1.note: Partial assessment without full project configuration

10.2.evidence: Logical script flow, proper information delivery

10.3.evidence: Customer name used consistently, good rapport building, conversation control maintained

10.6.evidence: Complete product and order information delivered

2.1.evidence: No call dropout or service refusal

1.1.evidence: Profanity detected in transcript at 42.167s ('херня'), but speaker diarization may be incorrect - contextually appears to be customer frustration, not operator. Requires audio verification.
1.1.note: Possible speaker labeling error - flagged for review but not penalized

4.1.evidence: Text shows patient handling of frustrated customer. Operator remained professional throughout technical difficulties.
4.1.note: Text-based assessment only; full tone analysis requires audio

positive_observations: Professional greeting with all required elements (company name, operator name, offer to help)
Patient handling of customer's website technical issues
Proactive problem-solving - offered manual order processing when website failed
Good communication about payment options and delivery details
Proper closing with thanks and polite farewell
Consistent use of customer name throughout call
Explained complex fuel bonus program clearly and thoroughly
Thanked customer for waiting during longer searches (2nd and 3rd searches)
Correctly applied echo method for phone number verification

data_quality.confidence_notes: Some speaker diarization inconsistencies noted around 42s mark. Word-level timestamps available for precise echo method detection.
